intro: Arkezostis villosissima, commonly known as the hairy bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant found in freshwater environments. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are covered in fine, hair-like structures. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically submerged or nearly so. It is a member of the Lentibulariaceae family, which includes other carnivorous plants. Its unique adaptations allow it to thrive in nutrient-poor waters by capturing small aquatic organisms.
